data.text:
Castleberry Johnson private 55th GA died of typhoid fever Cumberland Gap Jan 1863

The 55th Georgia Infantry Regiment was organized on May 17, 1862 at Camp Randolph, Georgia. The 1,008 men initially comprising the regiment came primarily from Hall, Jackson, and Walker Counties, Georgia. The unit was surrendered at Cumberland Gap on September 9, 1863. Those not captured were consolidated into three companies and served as guards at the POW camps at Andersonville, Georgia and Saulisbury, North Carolina. These companies were surrendered by General Jospeh E. Johnston on April 26, 1865 at Durham Station, Orange County, North Carolina.

The Confederate garrison at Cumberland Gap consisted of 2,500 men under the command of Brig. Gen. John W. Frazer. Confederate Units of 5th Brigade, Army of Tennessee - Brig. Gen. John W. Frazer Regiments: 62nd North Carolina Infantry Regiment - Major B. G. McDowell 64th North Carolina Infantry Regiment - Lieutenant Colonel Garrett 55th Georgia Infantry Regiment - Major Printup 64th Virginia Infantry Regiment - Colonel Slemp 1st Tennessee Cavalry Regiment - Colonel Carte 29th North Carolina Infantry Regiment Company E.Units

2,300 Confederate soldiers surrendered Sept 9 1863 after a three day siege.
